1.text: And passing by, he saw a man blind from birth.

2.text: And his disciples asked him, saying, Rabbi, who sinned, he, or his parents, that he was born blind?

3.text: Jesus answered, Neither did this sin, nor his parents: but that the works of God might be manifested in him.

4.text: I must work the works of him having sent me, while it is day: night comes, when none can work.

5.text: While I be in the world, I am the light of the world.

6.text: Having said these, he spat on the ground, and made clay of the spittle, and rubbed the clay upon the eyes of the blind,

7.text: And said to him, Retire, wash in the pool of Siloam, (which is interpreted, Sent.) He went away therefore, and washed, and came seeing.

8.text: Then the neighbors, and those seeing him before that he was blind, said, Is not this he sitting and begging?

9.text: Others said, This is he: and others, That he is like him: he said, That I am.

10.text: Then said they to him, How were thine eyes opened?

11.text: He answered and said, A man called Jesus made clay, and anointed mine eyes, and said to me, Retire to the pool of Siloam, and wash: and having gone and washed, I saw again.

12.text: Then said they to him, Where is he? He says I know not.

13.text: They bring him to the Pharisees, him once blind.

14.text: And it was the sabbath, when Jesus made clay, and opened his eyes.

15.text: Then again the Pharisees also asked him how he saw again. He said to them, He put clay upon mine eyes, and I washed, and I see.

16.text: Then said certain of the Pharisees, This man is not from God, for he keeps not the sabbath. Others said, How can a sinful man do such signs? And a division was among them.

17.text: They say to the blind again, What sayest thou of him, for he opened thine eyes? He said, That he is a prophet.

18.text: Then the Jews believed not of him that he was blind, and saw again, until they called the parents of him having looked up.

19.text: And they asked them, saying, Is this your son, whom ye say that be was born blind how then does be now see.

20.text: His parents answered them and said, We know that this is our son, and that he was born blind:

21.text: But how he now sees, we know not; or who opened his eyes, we know not: he has age; ask him: he shall speak for himself.

22.text: These said his parents, for they feared the Jews: for already had the Jews agreed, that if any should acknowledge him Christ, he should be put out of the synagogue.

23.text: Therefore said his parents, That he has age; ask him.

24.text: Then called they the man of a second time, who was blind, and said to him, Give glory to God: we know that this man is sinful.

25.text: He answered and said, If he be sinful, I know not: one thing I know, that, being blind, now I see.

26.text: And again said they to him, What did he to thee? how opened he thine eyes?

27.text: He answered them, I told you already, and ye heard not: why wish ye to hear again? ye wish not also to be his disciples?

28.text: Then they reviled him, and said, Thou art his disciple; but we are Mosesâ€™ disciples.

29.text: We know that God has spoken to Moses; but this, we know not whence he is.

30.text: The man answered and said to them, For in this is it wonderful, that ye know not whence he is, and he opened mine eyes.

31.text: And we know that God hears not the sinful: but if any be godly, and do his will, this he hears.

32.text: From forever was it not heard that any opened the eyes of him born blind.

33.text: If this one were not of God, he could do nothing.

34.text: They answered and said to him, In sins wert thou wholly born, and teachest thou us? And they cast him without.

35.text: Jesus heard that they cast him without; and having found him, said to him, Believest thou in the Son of God?

36.text: He answered and said, Who is he, Lord, that I might believe in him?

37.text: And Jesus said to him, Thou hast also seen him, and he speaking with thee, the same is he.

38.text: And he said I believe, Lord. And he worshipped him.

39.text: And Jesus said, For judgment came I into this world, that they not seeing might see; and they seeing might be blind.

40.text: And they being with him of the Pharisees heard these things, and said to him,

41.text: We are not also blind? Jesus said to them If ye were blind, ye had not sinned: and now ye say, That we see; therefore your sin remains.
